result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Adam L. Buchholtz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Consecutive to: Count 3

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:08 am case called. Defendant Adam L Buchholtz in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DA Blader regarding resolution and agreement reached. Amended information filed. Attorney Redding confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1, No Contest to Count 2, & No Contest to Count 3. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Reddin. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant on Count 1- Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 2 years.  Court admonishes defendant regarding bond during the pendency of PPDA. COUNT 2- Impose 30 days, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. COUNT 3-5 months WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. Consecutive to each other. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,  Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant to maintain employment. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney William Joseph Reddin in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Reddin states possible resolution but requests after 1st of the year for plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam L Buchholtz
Current: PO Box 325, W2059 County Road H, Poy Sippi, WI 54967-0325 United States  (Effective: 10-21-2015)
Prior: W2059 County Road H; PO Box 325, Poy Sippi, WI 54967

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:46 PM: Defendant Adam L Buchholtz in court with attorney William J. Reddin.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing today and ARGN today. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Def BOT.  ARGN to proceed today.  Counsel have already undertaken negotiations and discovery exchanged.  DA argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.   Defense has no objection to bond request.  INFO Filed.  Receipt Admitted and Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Probable cause exists as to Ct Nos 1 and 2 of the Complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:20 am.
from Attorney Reddin requesting a change in the time of the initial appearance - granted by the court
